title: Retro Chemistry Sets & Science Toys
description: Remember the excitement of real experiments at home? Test your knowledge of the science kits and educational toys that sparked curiosity!

questions.question: Which company produced the most famous chemistry sets for children in the 1950s and 1960s?

The A.C. Gilbert Company's most famous science toy, besides chemistry sets, was what?
What popular 1960s science toy let children grow colorful crystal formations?
The Gilbert U-238 Atomic Energy Lab, sold from 1950-1951, actually contained samples of what?
What classic science toy allowed children to observe tiny creatures by adding water to a powder?
Sea-Monkeys were actually what type of creature?
What Uncle Milton toy, introduced in 1956, let children watch insects tunnel through sand between two panes of glass?
What popular 1970s toy used heat from a light bulb to create rubbery toy figures from liquid plastic?
The rock tumbler toy, popular in the 1970s, transformed rough stones into what?
What simple science experiment, popular with children for decades, involved combining baking soda and vinegar?
The Visible Man and Visible Woman model kits taught children about what?
What educational toy, introduced by Texas Instruments in 1967, was one of the first handheld electronic learning devices?
What classic children's toy telescope came as a kit that had to be assembled and could actually observe the moon?
Shrinky Dinks, introduced in 1973, worked by what principle?
options: Heating polystyrene plastic sheets that shrank and thickened in the oven
